p: To our best knowledge, there is still no data available concerning the antimalarial properties of the most cited plants in this study, namely: Ochna kirkii Oliv., Ehretia amoena Klotzsch and Pteleopsis myrtifolia (M.A.Lawson) Engl. & Diels. Further phytochemical and pharmacological studies are needed. However, other plants with taxonomic proximity, such as Ochna integerrima (Lour.) Merr. present a significant in vitro antiplasmodial activity [ 102].
